metadata.title: CVE-2016-2856 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
pt_chown in the glibc package before 2.19-18+deb8u4 on Debian jessie; theelibc package before 2.15-0ubuntu10.14 on Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and before2.19-0ubuntu6.8 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS; and the glibc package before2.21-0ubuntu4.2 on Ubuntu 15.10 and before 2.23-0ubuntu1 on Ubuntu 16.04LTS and 16.10 lacks a namespace check associated with file-descriptorpassing, which allows local users to capture keystrokes and spoof data, andpossibly gain privileges, via pts read and write operations, related todebian/sysdeps/linux.mk.  NOTE: this is not considered a vulnerability inthe upstream GNU C Library because the upstream documentation has a clearsecurity recommendation against the --enable-pt_chown option.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.8').
